channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NH

item.title: Report E-2023120228
item.description:
Report E-2023120228

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-20T18:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GREENWOOD MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit (4) -(1) pint jugs were crushed due to unprotracted freight. (1) cup of material was released.

item.title: Report X-2023120671
item.description:
Report X-2023120671

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-10
  • City: LONDONDERRY
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package already at QA cage when discovered. Clear signs of leakage(not water damage), however no signs of ongoing leakage or damage to containers. Contents placed in salvage drum in plastic bags to prevent any further spills. DescribePack: No signs of damage on plastic containers. Very clear indication that some of it leaked. Unable to determine source of leak, presumably loose caps that were since tightened. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was already in a red spill tote when discovered, plastic bag lining the tote.
